intro: Petrophile intricata, commonly known as the intricate rock-heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Epacridaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or inland heathlands. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
